intro: Psoralea virgata, commonly known as the slender psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in grassland habitats. Its leaves are trifoliate, and the flowers are usually pale yellow to greenish in color. Psoralea virgata is adapted to arid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators.
